title: Encryption key rotation breaks data source credentials
description:
When SESSION_SECRET is rotated, decrypt_or_raw() in src/crypto.rs falls back to returning raw base64 ciphertext instead of plaintext JSON, making data source credentials (Tempest tokens, AC Infinity passwords) unrecoverable. The fallback was designed for legacy unencrypted plaintext, not for ciphertext encrypted with a stale key.

Options to fix:
1. Separate ENCRYPTION_KEY env var so session and encryption keys rotate independently
2. OLD_ENCRYPTION_KEY env var that tries current key first, falls back to old key, then re-encrypts on read
3. Document that key rotation requires manual credential re-entry (simplest)

Affects: src/crypto.rs decrypt_or_raw()

title: TEA Pattern Bypassed in Home Page
description: AGENTS.md prescribes strict adherence to The Elm Architecture (TEA) where all state transitions go through 'Msg' and side effects go through 'Cmd'. However, src/pages/home.rs bypasses this by using Leptos Resources directly for domain data and raw leptos::task::spawn_local calls for async mutations (e.g., on_add, on_update), making the TEA 'Model' handle only UI state. We need to reconcile this architectural divergence.
close_reason: WONTFIX: The application was rewritten to use Leptos SSR, Resources, and Server Functions which idiomatically replaces the need for TEA Msg/Cmd polling. Updating the docs to reflect this design choice instead.

title: Implement Account Lockout for Repeated Failed Login Attempts
